org.mockftpserver.fake.filesystem

Class Permissions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mockftpserver.fake.filesystem.Permissions

  • public class Permissions
extends Object
    Represents and encapsulates the read/write/execute permissions for a file or directory. This is conceptually (and somewhat loosely) based on the permissions flags within the Unix file system. An instance of this class is immutable.
    Version:
    $Revision: 182 $ - $Date: 2008-11-30 21:37:49 -0500 (Sun, 30 Nov 2008) $
    Author:
    Chris Mair

    • Constructor Detail

      • Permissions

        public Permissions(String rwxString)
        Costruct a new instance for the specified read/write/execute specification String
        Parameters:
        rwxString - - the read/write/execute specification String; must be 9 characters long, with chars at index 0,3,6 == '-' or 'r', chars at index 1,4,7 == '-' or 'w' and chars at index 2,5,8 == '-' or 'x'.

    • Method Detail

      • asRwxString

        public String asRwxString()
        Return the read/write/execute specification String representing the set of permissions. For example: "rwxrwxrwx" or "rw-r-----".
        Returns:
        the String containing 9 characters that represent the read/write/execute permissions.

      • getRwxString

        public String getRwxString()
        Returns:
        the RWX string for this instance
